verse: You people are in for trouble! You have made cruel and unfair laws
that let you cheat the poor and needy and rob widows and orphans.
But what will you do when you are fiercely attacked and punished by foreigners? Where will you run for help? Where will you hide your valuables?
How will you escape being captured or killed? The Lord is still angry, and he isn’t through with you yet!

header: The Lord’s Purpose and the King of Assyria

verse: The Lord says:
The king of Assyria says:
The Lord will do what he has planned against Jerusalem and Mount Zion. Then he will punish the proud and boastful king of Assyria,
who says:
King of Assyria, can an ax or a saw overpower the one who uses it? Can a wooden pole lift whoever holds it?
The mighty Lord All-Powerful will send a terrible disease to strike down your army, and you will burn with fever under your royal robes.
The holy God, who is the light of Israel, will turn into a fire, and in one day you will go up in flames, just like a thornbush.
The Lord will make your beautiful forests and fertile fields slowly rot.
There will be so few trees that even a young child can count them.

header: Only a Few Will Come Back

verse: A time is coming when the survivors from Israel and Judah will completely depend on the holy Lord of Israel, instead of the nation that defeated them.

There were as many people as there are grains of sand along the seashore, but only a few will survive to come back to Israel’s mighty God. This is because he has threatened to destroy their nation, just as they deserve.
The Lord All-Powerful has promised that everyone on this earth will be punished.
Now the Lord God All-Powerful says to his people in Jerusalem:
Enemy troops have reached the town of Aiath. They have gone through Migron, and they stored their supplies at Michmash,
before crossing the valley and spending the night at Geba. The people of Ramah are terrified; everyone in Gibeah, the hometown of Saul, has run away.
Loud crying can be heard in the towns of Gallim, Laishah, and sorrowful Anathoth.
No one is left in Madmenah or Gebim.
Today the enemy will camp at Nob and shake a threatening fist at Mount Zion in Jerusalem.
